Recap: Jonathan and Tammy get into an argument then make love. Lizzie asks Marina for advice. Reva and the Widower get friendlier Lillian tries once again to get rid of Alan. Alan goes right by Lillian to the baby. Josh and Cassie have a tender moment together. Marina says no to Lizzie. Jonathan and Tammy continue their romance. Josh meets Billy's new girlfriend and likes what he sees and hears from her. Reva and new friend (widower) get chummier. Lillian finally throws Alan out. Lizzie an Cassie talk about Jonathan and Tammy and Lizzie thanks Cassie for the invitation to the Lewis Christmas party. Cassie tells Lizzie she is not going to get in the middle of the Lizzie, Jonathan, Tammy triangle. Alan finally gets to see Lizzie and reads her another riot act about family (give me a break.). Jonathan show up just in time to tell Alan that Lizzie isn't alone.
Transcript: Jonathan: You don't get to do this.
Tammy: I have to.
Jonathan: You are the one who told me to go. You said that would be the right thing.
Tammy: I love you. I was wrong about that. I have never stopped loving you.
Jonathan: Lizzie is right inside.
Tammy: Okay. Fine. Go back inside to her and let her lie to you some more then.
Jonathan: What? What?
Tammy: You don't have a real marriage. You share a baby and some space, okay? That's it.
Jonathan: Tammy, what the hell?
Tammy: You don't want to go back in there. You could have gone in and out five times by now, but you're still out here with me, aren't you?
Jonathan: You're making this worse.
Tammy: This is just the beginning. This is just going to get worse and worse because you and I both know that no matter how many times we try to end this, this is not going to end.
Jonathan: Go, go. You do not get to do this to me anymore. You don't get to follow me. You do not get to show up where I am. You don't get to torture me like that, so stop.
Tammy: Make me.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: Come on, Jonathan, where are you? It's our big night out. Uncle Rick, Frank, have either of you seen Jonathan?
Rick: We don't hang out much these days.
Frank: What's the matter, Lizzie? Lost your husband?
Lizzie: No, of course not. He's around here somewhere. Oh, Marina, you have to help me find Jonathan.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cal: How strong can I make your drink?
Reva: Oh, not strong, no. Club soda. Please, sir.
Cal: Who let the stiff in?
Reva: Hey, I'm pacing myself. I already had a few at the party.
Cal: Oh, yeah, heck of a party.
Reva: Tell you had a real blast.
Cal: Yeah. You know what my favorite part was? Was when I met your second ex, the one who's not dating your sister.
Reva: I knew I shouldn't have dragged you over there. Have I completely scared you off?
Cal: No. You know, dating two brothers, I mean, that's... that's not weird, is it?
Reva: Actually, it gets weirder. I've been tangled up with a Lewis man just as... about as long as I can remember.
Cal: Well, then, maybe it's time to get untangled, so you should get tangled with somebody else.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lillian: Oh, good lord!
Alan: No, it's just me. Hello, Lillian.
Lillian: Don't do this. If you push me, I'm going to push you back.
Alan: I'm just out spreading a little holiday cheer; that's all. Now, you can't say no to that.
Lillian: I told you not to come here. There's a restraining order.
Alan: I just want to see Sarah; that's all.
Lillian: I know what you want to do.
Alan: Her mother and father aren't here, so what's the harm, huh?
Lillian: Alan....
Alan: How would you feel if you weren't allowed to see her, huh?
Lillian: You stay right there.
Alan: Hello there, gorgeous. You know, your mommy and daddy don't want me near you. But what they don't know won't hurt them, will it?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cassie: Mm. These are really good. Who brought these?
Josh: I think it was Buzz.
Cassie: Well, the food's almost gone.
Josh: Yeah.
Cassie: I would say this was a success.
Josh: I would say so. The question is, how do we get rid of all these people?
Cassie: Some host you are.
Josh: The host wants to be alone with you.
Cassie: Oh, he does, does he?
Josh: Come here with me for just a second.
Cassie: Oh, yeah. It's time to kick them all out.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Marina: Lizzie, will you stop freaking out? He's around here somewhere.
Lizzie: Okay. Where?
Marina: I don't know. Maybe he's hanging out with R.J. or something.
Lizzie: R.J.? Yeah, of course. I don't know why I didn't think of that.
Marina: Well, we've checked everywhere down here, so why don't you go upstairs and see if they're playing video games?
Lizzie: I don't need to check on him. I'm not one of those hovering wives, Marina.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Billy: Hey.
Josh: Hi.
Billy: Nice party.
Josh: Thank you. And really glad you're here.
Sheila: Yeah, I love this old farmhouse.
Josh: Well, that's all Cassie. I'm a relative newcomer here.
Billy: Here's to new beginnings.
All: To new beginnings.
Josh: You seem like you're in a very good mood tonight.
Billy: I certainly am. It's all because of this young lady right here.
Sheila: Oh! Has he always been such a charmer?
Josh: Yes, as a matter of fact, and it used to get him into a lot of trouble.
Sheila: Oh!
Josh: Yeah, I could... I could tell you some stories.
Billy: Now, wait a minute, wait a minute.
Sheila: Oh, please do, yeah.
Josh: I don't even know where to begin. Maybe... let's start with the college football hero days. They were pretty wicked.
Billy: Josh, Josh, Josh, Josh. I don't want to scare her away.
Sheila: Oh, please. I don't scare off that easily.
Josh: Okay. Well, you and I will talk later.
Sheila: Okay.
Josh: And by the way, I want to say thank you. You're a good influence on my brother.
Billy: You certainly are.
Sheila: Oh, thank you.
Billy: No, I'm serious. I... I haven't felt like this... I mean, I am my old self again.
Josh: Well, that's a good thing.
Billy: Yeah, it is. And I'll tell you something. We're going to go places with this company. You... you wait and see.
Sheila: Yeah, that's all he talks about, being back at Lewis and working with you again.
Josh: Really?
Sheila: Yes, he does. And that's exactly how I like my guy: Driven and fun.
Billy: Oh, yeah. (Laughs)
Sheila: Don't forget the fun, okay?
Billy: Hey, Josh, we went out two-stepping last night. I'm telling you, you and Cassie will have to come with us next time.
Josh: Oh, yee-haw.
Billy: Yeah!
Josh: Yeah, I'll make sure to ask her about that.
Sheila: So, do you want me to freshen up your drinks?
Billy: No, I'm good, thanks.
Josh: Nah, I'm fine, thanks.
Sheila: I'll be back.
Josh: Thank you very much. Yeah. She's too good for you.
Billy: Everybody's too good for me. (Laughter)
Josh: No, I'm very, very happy for you. You found yourself a good one there.
Billy: Actually, Reva found her.
Josh: Go figure.
Billy: Yeah.
Josh: You... you did a lot for Reva. Must be nice to have things be a little less crazy.
Billy: For all of us.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cal: So what do you say we start our own little holiday party?
Reva: Fa-la-la... (giggles) ...la-la... (laughs) ...la-la! Mm! Ah! Surprise. (Laughs) I really... I don't really think I'm ready for this just yet.
Cal: Okay.
Reva: No, really. (Laughs) Come on! I... I'm not. I... I seem to have lost my party girl edge. Now what do you think about that?
Cal: Well, you should just ease into it.
Reva: Maybe. You know, I always seem to marry the men I sleep with, anyway.
Cal: Okay! Okay, all right then. Okay. So it's a good thing that we stopped where we did.
Reva: What, you're not ready for a lifetime commitment?

Cal: (Laughs) You know, it's just that I've... I've probably been divorced about as many times as you have. And, well, to tell you the truth, I'm still a little baffled that I have a lifetime ahead of me.
Reva: You too, huh? I mean, a month ago, I thought I'd be pushing up daisies. And now look at me.
Cal: Look at you.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan: Can I hold her?
Lillian: Oh, no, because you'd put her under your arm like a football and run out of here.
Alan: Why would I do that? She's my family. She's our family, Lillian.
Lillian: Oh, don't play that with me, Alan.
Alan: Why are you so supportive of Jonathan and Elizabeth's sham of a marriage, anyway?
Lillian: If you'd stop calling it a sham of a marriage, maybe you'd be allowed to see this precious little girl. Isn't that what you really want?
Alan: Jonathan doesn't care about Sarah or Elizabeth. Why are you pretending they have this normal marriage? Of course, you've done that all your life, especially with your family.
Lillian: Oh. Since I'm so good at pretending, I guess I'll just pretend you didn't say that. It's time for you to go.
Alan: No, no, I apologize.
Lillian: No, no, you're out of here.
Alan: I just got here, Lillian.
Lillian: You're lucky I invited you in. Now, get out of here.
Alan: Wait, I've got all these gifts.
Lillian: Do you want me to call the police?
Alan: I've got these gifts to...
Lillian: Come on. Bye.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: Hey, Cassie. Can I help?
Cassie: Sure.
Lizzie: These?
Cassie: Yeah.
Lizzie: Thanks for inviting us. It feels so good to be out. This is me and Jonathan's first night out without the baby.
Cassie: Well, I'm glad you had a nice time.
Lizzie: You should see Jonathan with Sarah. He's amazing.
Cassie: Yeah, who... who'd have guessed it, huh?
Lizzie: You and Josh seem happy. How did you get him to stop obsessing about his past? I could really use the advice. You and I are kind of in the same boat.
Cassie: Lizzie, Tammy is my daughter. I'm not going to...
Lizzie: Right. Yeah, right. How is Tammy? She looked a little freaked out when she walked in.
Cassie: She's fine. She's... she's getting on with her life. Don't worry about her at all, really.
Lizzie: Good. That's great.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: You are so... even though I know I shouldn't....
Jonathan: Shh. I feel like I can breathe for the first time in months. I just want to touch you and smell you and taste you and just pretend there's no outside world, okay?
Tammy: There isn't.
Jonathan: There isn't.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cal: (Laughs) I'll split it with you.
Reva: Oh, no. I've had way too much sugar as it is. Yuck! All I want to do is get up on this bed and jump up and down.
Cal: I knew we were going to get this bed squeaking somehow.
Reva: Would you get over here? You're missing the last part of the movie.
Cal: Pay-per-view and candy bars. Where did I lose my edge?
Reva: Probably about the time you lost your hair.
Cal: You too, huh?
Reva: Who said I lost my edge?
Cal: Not me.
Reva: Oh, see, it's over. Are you going to find me a ride home?
Cal: If I have to.
Reva: (Laughs)
Cal: See? There is life after the Lewis brothers.
Reva: I know there is. It's just weird, you know? Watching them go on with their lives. Without me. It's kind of like I really did die.
Cal: Well, that can be freeing.
Reva: I was the one who pushed Josh and Cassie together. I set Billy up with Sheila, kind of like a lovely parting gift.
Cal: Billy's not really interested in Sheila, is he?
Reva: Why?
Cal: No reason.
Reva: Why, Caleb?
Cal: I've heard stories about Sheila. Billy could be in some real trouble.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: For you. There you go. (Laughter)
Sheila: Yeah, we should get dinner soon.
Cassie: We're there.
Sheila: All right. And then we can go out dancing afterwards.
Billy: Yeah.
Cassie: Uh, dancing?
Josh: Yeah, that's right. Billy and Sheila have taken up two-stepping.
Cassie: Well, in that case, I'll have to dust off my cowboy boots. (Laughter)
[SCENE_BREAK]
Frank: Okay, ready sweetheart?
Rick: As ready as I'll ever be, Frankie.
Marina: Oh, my God. I... I'm going to get the coats.
Frank: What are you stealing now?
Lizzie: Jonathan's not upstairs. I've looked everywhere. He's not in the house.
Marina: Well, did you try calling him?
Lizzie: Yes. He didn't pick up the phone.
Marina: Is his car here?
Lizzie: Yes, but....
Marina: Then he's around here somewhere, isn't he, Lizzie? Listen, from what I hear, Jonathan's not really big on the whole family gathering thing. There's no need for you to worry.
Lizzie: How can I not worry? He disappeared.
Marina: Let go of the leash, Lizzie. Listen, Jonathan is trying to do right by you and the baby, but you've got to give the guy a little bit of space.
Lizzie: No, not tonight. Tonight, we are supposed to be together.
Frank: Hey, Lizzie. What's the matter?
Marina: Lizzie can't find her husband.
Josh: Well, he was here earlier. Did you check, I don't know, R.J.'S room, maybe?
Lizzie: Yes, yes, I checked there. He's not there.
Marina: I told her it's no big deal. Here's probably just out taking a walk. Right?
Cassie: Yeah, I'm sure he'll show up.
Rick: Lizzie, do you need a ride?
Lizzie: No, Uncle Rick, I need my husband.
Josh: Yeah.
Cassie: Josh?
Josh: Okay, I'll get my coat and see what I can do.
Frank: Josh, do you need help?
Josh: No, no, that's all right. Go home. And thank you for coming.
Frank: Thank you.
Rick: Good food, great cookies.
Cassie: Thank you for coming, sweetie.
Rick: Thanks, Cassie.
Cassie: Good night.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Tammy: I wish you could stay here forever, and I could just live in this barn.
Jonathan: (Sighs) Yeah.
Tammy: But we can't, can we? What are you thinking about?
Jonathan: Sarah. I tried so hard to make everything as right for her.
Tammy: You did. She's a very lucky little girl.
Jonathan: Yeah, we'll see in about 20 years.
Tammy: We will see. I know it.
Jonathan: Not with a dad like me.
Tammy: Why are you being so down on yourself?
Jonathan: Well, it's just not just about her. It's about you, too, you know? I wanted you to be proud of me.
Tammy: I am proud of you. You love your daughter, and then look at everything that you've done already to make her safe and give her a good home.
Jonathan: What does that matter if I ruin it?
Tammy: How?
Jonathan: (Scoffs) Never mind.
Tammy: No, Jonathan. Why do you think you're going to ruin it?
Jonathan: Doing this?
Tammy: What?
Jonathan: I can't. I can't be that guy. I tried.
Tammy: Jonathan. Hey, you don't have to try to be anything, okay? I love you. More than ever. I can't even imagine my life without you in it.
[SCENE_BREAK]

Stephanie Gatschet, "Inside The Light." I grew up in Philly. "Filthy-delphia," as we like to call it. 215. Got a lot of pride in Philadelphia. Moving to New York was probably one of the most exciting things I've ever done in my life. I mean, it's the biggest, coolest city in the world, and to live here when you're young and just... just kind of starting out and all that, it's the coolest thing ever. See Tammy, Wednesday, December 20, "Inside The Light."
[SCENE_BREAK]
Alan: Elizabeth?
Lizzie: Granddad.
Tammy: Who is that?
Jonathan: Does it matter? I can't get caught like this.
Tammy: You go out the back.
Jonathan: Hey, I didn't want it to end like this.
Tammy: Okay, go.
Lizzie: Go home, Granddad. You shouldn't be here.
Alan: We have to discuss Sarah.
Lizzie: There is nothing to discuss. She is off limits to you, and so am I. Or did you forget about the restraining order?
Alan: The order keeps me away from her, not you.
Lizzie: I am at a party at Josh and Cassie's. You don't belong here.
Alan: I know, and you can go back to your hoe-down in just a minute. But first we need to...
Lizzie: I don't have anything to say to you, actually.
Alan: Elizabeth, please.
Josh: Alan! You know, I just don't remember inviting you.
Lizzie: He was just leaving.
Alan: If you don't mind, I'm having a private conversation with my granddaughter.
Cassie: Actually, we do mind. This is our house, and you're not welcome here.
Alan: But Jonathan Randall is. By the way, where is your husband?
Lizzie: He's inside.
Alan: Well, good. Well, let's go in and get him then.
Josh: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa.
Cassie: Alan, what's it going to take to get rid of you?
Alan: Is this the way you treat all of your guests, Cassie?
Josh: What do you want, Alan?
Alan: I want you to realize that raising that child in an unhealthy home with unhappy parents is not a good thing.
Lizzie: You are lecturing me on a happy home?
Alan: Okay, you can banish me from your life, but that won't make me stop caring about you. I just want you to know you're not alone in this.
Jonathan: Listen to that. For once, you're right, Alan. Lizzie's not alone.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: So tell me more about Sheila.
Cal: What's to tell? She likes men with money.
Reva: I like men with money.
Cal: (Scoffs) She only likes men with money.
Reva: Well, how do you know her?
Cal: I met her at the Clayton Country Club.
Reva: Clayton, huh?
Cal: Yeah.
Reva: Well....
Cal: I know her here, too.
Reva: Why didn't you ever say anything about how... knowing her?
Cal: Probably wouldn't everyone recognize me. She dated a... dated a business acquaintance of mine.
Reva: So you don't really know.
Cal: Well, I've... I... people talk.
Reva: Yeah, well, you know what? I've been on the end of that kind of talk before, and they're not always right.
Cal: I'm pretty sure about this.
Reva: I introduced them.
Cal: Well, maybe you should warn Billy.
Reva: Oh, no, I can't do that.
Cal: Why not?
Reva: Because they're just rumors.
Cal: Well, sometimes rumors are true.
Reva: Yeah, but I don't think Billy would really appreciate it if I told him how to live his life. I know I wouldn't.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Rick: It's all clear, Frankie. Come on in.
Frank: This is ridiculous. This is my sister's house. I'm allowed to be here. I even have my own little key, see?
Rick: But you... the thing is, we didn't go over the rules as far as bringing friends over the house.
Frank: How old are you?
Rick: Frankie, I'm too old to be crashing at somebody else's house, but here I am. I'm thirsty. Do you want a beer?
Frank: No, that's all right. Maybe a cup of coffee, thanks.
Rick: We don't want to make too much noise.
Frank: I'll make it.
Rick: I tell you, if you wake up Harley and the boys, Harley will have your head. She threw a can opener at me the other day.
Frank: Okay, I'll have a cup of milk. Anyway, do you have any of those cookies that you stole from Cassie's? I didn't eat much tonight.
Rick: Yeah. The white ones were really good. There you go. That was a good party.
Frank: Yeah, yeah. You know, it was. I was really dreading the party, you know, that whole Josh/Reva/Cassie thing. But, I don't know, it turned out all right.
Rick: Everyone except for Lizzie.
Frank: Yeah. Yeah, every time I think about Marina not having a boyfriend, I just tell myself, "Thank God she's not married to Jonathan Randall."
Rick: Hear, hear, pal.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Jonathan: Get the hell out of here, Alan.
Alan: It's nice to see you, too, Mr. Randall.
Jonathan: My wife and I are trying to have a nice night out. Thanks for ruining it.
Alan: I have every right to see my granddaughter.
Jonathan: Not if she doesn't want to see you.
Lizzie: Just go. We're trying to have a life.
Alan: You call living with him "having a life"?
Jonathan: Do you see what you're doing to her? Do you see, Alan? She doesn't deserve that. She just wants to have a normal family for her kid. She doesn't want you coming...
Lizzie: Just go. Go! Please.
Jonathan: Maybe we should get out of here.
Lizzie: Thanks for inviting us. I'm really sorry about all of this.
Josh: Don't be sorry. Don't be sorry about anything. Alan wasn't even supposed to be here.
Lizzie: I think my purse is inside.
Cassie: Sweetie. Where did you come from?
Tammy: R.J.'s room. He's asleep.
Cassie: Well, it was a big night for him. For all of us.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: Thank you.
Cal: Mm-hmm.
Reva: I had a really nice time.
Cal: Let's do it again sometime.
Reva: Definitely. Hi!
Sheila: Hi.
Reva: Are you guys just getting back from the party?
Billy: Actually, we stopped by Company and had a little something to eat.
Reva: Uh-huh.
Sheila: This one had a hearty appetite-- pancakes, sausage, eggs, bacon, and plus apple pie, right? (Laughs)
Reva: Don't I know.
Billy: Did you have fun tonight?
Reva: Huh?
Billy: Fun?
Reva: Yeah.
Sheila: Oh, yeah, you and you date left early.
Reva: Cal! Yeah, we came back here, actually, to watch a... a movie.
Billy: Sounds like fun.
Sheila: Honey, I'm tired.
Billy: Okay. We're going to go.
Reva: Can I just grab you just for a minute?
Billy: How about another time?
Sheila: It's okay. You go ahead. I'm going to go wash my makeup off, okay?
Billy: Okay.
Sheila: Good night.
Reva: Good night.
Billy: Are you okay?
Reva: Yeah. Yeah, yeah. In fact, we just didn't get much of a chance to talk at the party. So what do you think of Cal?
Billy: He seems nice enough.
Reva: Yeah, we're both lucky there, huh? Me and Cal, you and Sheila. What does she do for a living, anyway? I mean, does she live around here? Does she have family here or...
Billy: Wait, what's the 20 questions for?
Reva: Well, no, I'm just curious, you know? I mean, it takes a while to get to know somebody, and I just wondered how well you know her.
Billy: Hey, what is this?
Reva: Do you mind if I want to know a little bit about the person yourself dating?
Billy: No, but I know that look. Hey, look, I'll make it easy for you. You did a good thing with Sheila, okay?
Reva: You guys are moving fast.
Billy: Hey, what are you doing?
Reva: I'm just asking!
Billy: No, no, you told me to get a life. I got a life. Now, I'm sorry if you all of a sudden decided that you don't... but darling, you got no say in this, okay? I'm going to go to bed. Good night.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Rick: What do you think of these shoes, Frankie?
Frank: Well, they're all right.
Rick: Think they're sexy?
Frank: Do you want them to be sexy, Rick?
Rick: I don't know, Frank. I mean, it just occurred to me if my wife doesn't take me back, I'm going to be out there again, you know? In the world, trying to meet and pick up women. God.
Frank: Look, you'll be fine. Maybe I'll sic Marina on you. (Chuckles)
Rick: Thanks, Frankie.
Frank: I didn't mean like that.
Rick: Oh.

Frank: Look, she tries to give me a makeover once a year, okay? I think she's looking for a new victim. You'll be perfect. What's the matter with you? You don't think you and Mel are going to work out?
Rick: I don't know, Frank. I just don't know.
Frank: Well, what about Beth?

Rick: No, there's no me and Beth, okay? One, you know, she's still married to Alan; and two, you know, this, whatever this was that we, you know, was just two people trying to recapture their youth, and it doesn't work. It just... I mean, let's just say Beth and I worked to get together. I mean, there'll be a part of me always wondered if... what would happen if Phillip walked back in the door again?
Frank: Oh, man. Don't even.. don't even go there.
Rick: No, I'm not going to.
Frank: You know, what is wrong with people these days, you know? Why don't they try and... why don't they try to do everything they can just to stick together?

Rick: Well, hey, listen, Frank, I think it was hard way back when, when her grandparents made it look so easy. I mean, my Grandma Bert, greatest lady in the world, but I know that she had a tough time of it. Man, I miss her. I miss a lot of people this time of year.
Frank: Yeah, you and me both.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: Hey, Nana. We're on our way home. Do you need anything?
Lillian: No, honey. Did you have a nice time?
Lizzie: Yeah, yeah, it was okay.
Lillian: Well, what's wrong?
Lizzie: Granddad stopped by.
Lillian: He did? When will that man ever give up?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cassie: So you are staying over, sweetie?
Tammy: Is that okay?
Cassie: Heck, yeah, that's okay. Good night, Jonathan.
Jonathan: Good night.
Tammy: Did I hear Alan?
Jonathan: Mm-hmm.
Tammy: What was he doing here?
Jonathan: Came to attack me and Lizzie. What else? Took care of him, though.
Cassie: What just happened out there? That was amazing.
Jonathan: Yeah. I waited a long time for that.
Tammy: Too long.
Jonathan: Too long.
Lizzie: Are you ready to go?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: Cassie, you know what? That can wait.
Cassie: Josh, you know, it's going to drive me crazy.
Josh: Yeah, well, you know what? Let me drive you crazy instead.
Cassie: Now, you're not ready for bed, are you?
Josh: No, no, no. We can... we can hang out down here for a little while. Why don't you just have a seat. Did you have fun?
Cassie: I sure did. Although I'm a little worried about Tammy.
Josh: Well, it does seem like she's starting to get over Jonathan, though.

Cassie: Oh, I don't know about that. But, you know, the good thing is I think people are kind of getting more okay with us, don't you think? They seemed relaxed and happy. Kind of gives me hope for the future.
Josh: What have I been telling you all this time?
Cassie: Oh, is that what you've been telling me all this time?
Josh: Uh-huh. Excuse me for just a second.
Cassie: Where are you going? (Music playing) Dancing?
Josh: Kind of sort of.
Cassie: Now, this doesn't mean we're going to have to two- step with Billy and Sheila, does it?
Josh: Absolutely not.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Reva: Billy, wait.
Billy: Why?
Reva: I may be crossing the line, but I just don't want to see you get hurt.
Billy: Oh, that's classic. You get to hurt me but somebody else, well, they can't really...
Reva: This isn't about me.
Billy: Yes, this is always about you. Reva, look, you made it painfully clear that you weren't interested in me. So who I see and what I do with them is none of your business now, okay? Got it?
Reva: Well, sue me for caring about you!
Billy: Give it a rest. You've got a life, I got a life, Josh has a life.

Reva: Maybe Josh can kick some sense into you. Hey, Joshua, it's me. I found out something tonight that has me worried about Billy. I don't mean to call you on something, it's just... you're always the one that always fixes things, so I... never mind. Forget about it. I'll handle it myself.
[SCENE_BREAK]
